strings.Value: "Who are you? Or what are you?"
"Get out of my head, now!"
"What do you want?"
"Why do you speak so strangely?"
"I'm not inclined to trust strange voices in my head. Show yourself."
"Where is this stone you spoke of?"
"I think I should leave."
"I'll... see what I can do. I'll go there now and take care of the 'predators'."
"Reward? You will reward me if I help you?"
"Who sent you here, and why?"
{n}You hear a strange, faint humming noise, like a swarm of locusts in the distance — then suddenly, the noise rises to a painful shrieking in your ears!{/n}
{n}Suddenly, you find you can make out words in the din — the words are disjointed and hard to make out, but someone is clearly trying to speak to you.{/n} "Help, yes?"
"Traveler. Way home. Friend. Jester. Jest. Escape. Trap. Pain. Wound. Blood. Powerlessness. Blood. Cold. Heat. Darkness. Darkness. Darkness. Light. Predators. Attack. Run. Loss."
"Wish. Home."
"Help. Help. Help. Help. Help..." {n}The creature keeps repeating the word over and over again, until it is swallowed by the painful background hum.{/n}
"Stone. Predators. Multitude. Powerlessness. Help. Defense. Cleanup. Path. Home."

{n}Drawing upon your arcane knowledge, you discern that the strange being, whatever it may be, has stumbled into a trap which turned out to be a portal, and was injured. You are not sure what the predators are it mentioned, but they must have attacked the creature while it was on this side of the portal.{/n}

{n}You are able to piece the jumbled words together with some difficultly — near as you can tell, the stranger is asking you to get rid of the mysterious "predators" that drove it away from the stone.{/n}
"Rescue. Predators. Banishment. Death. Reward. Presents."
{n}Rustling and whistling is all you hear in response.{/n}
"Fear. Fright."
"Straight. Hill. Top."
"Who are you talking to? Me?" {n}Octavia looks around with a raised eyebrow.{/n} "There's no one here. Are you seeing things?"
{n}Ekun freezes and watches you closely. He remains silent, but you notice he is reaching for his weapon.{/n}
"Easy there! If you've decided to act the fool and start talking to yourself, at least stop shouting!"
"What, is this a jest? I must say, you've picked a poor time to show off your... Sense of humor. Drop this ridiculous charade at once."
"Help! Help! Hill! Top! Predators! Home! Home!" {n}The humming in your head fades, then vanishes entirely.{/n}
"Home. Wish. Gratitude. Presents."
"No idea who you were talking to just now, but seems we're in for another adventure!"

"Wonderful. Our fearless {mf|baron|baroness|king|queen}, who, mind you, has not at all taken leave of any of {mf|his|her} senses, except for the 'common' one, has struck a deal with {mf|his|her} imaginary friends. My heart may rest easy! Surely, these 'predators' are nothing more but an unruly mob of meadow bunnies."

"Don't take this the wrong way, but... have you lost your mind? You were talking to yourself! Are you sure that we should do whatever it is you were talking about with your... errm-m-m... invisible interlocutor?"
"Presents. Bag. Items. Multitude. Hill. Predators. Banishment."
"Friend. Jester. Fey."
